treatments: Chickenpox is managed symptomatically with antihistamines for itching, fever reducers like acetaminophen, and maintaining good hygiene to prevent secondary bacterial infections.For severe cases or in individuals at higher risk of complications, antiviral medication such as acyclovir may be prescribed. preventive strategies: Get vaccinated if you have not had chickenpox. Avoid close contact with infected individuals. Encourage vaccination for children and adults. Isolate infected individuals to prevent the spread of the virus.

treatments: Acne treatment varies from topical treatments like benzoyl peroxide and retinoids to oral antibiotics or hormonal therapy for severe cases. preventive strategies: Keep your skin clean but avoid excessive washing. Use non-comedogenic skincare products. Avoid picking or squeezing pimples, as this can worsen acne and lead to scarring. Choose oil-free and non-comedogenic skincare and makeup products.

Symptoms: I have been experiencing severe back pain, a persistent cough, and weakness in my limbs. My neck also hurts and I have been feeling dizzy and off balance.
treatments: Cervical spondylosis treatment involves physical therapy, pain relievers, and in some cases, surgery to relieve pressure on the spinal cord.Neck exercises and physical therapy can help improve mobility and reduce pain. Pain relievers or muscle relaxants may be prescribed.
preventive strategies: Maintain good posture. Do neck-strengthening exercises. Use ergonomically designed furniture and equipment. Take short breaks from prolonged sitting and computer use.

preventive strategies: Take malaria prophylaxis if traveling to endemic areas. Use mosquito nets and repellent. Sleep under insecticide-treated bed nets. Take antimalarial medications as prescribed when traveling to endemic areas.

treatments: GERD is managed with lifestyle changes diet, weight management, medications like proton pump inhibitors PPIs, and sometimes surgery for severe cases.Lifestyle changes may include elevating the head of the bed and avoiding eating close to bedtime. preventive strategies: Avoid trigger foods and overeating.Maintain a healthy weight. Eat smaller, more frequent meals. Avoid lying down immediately after eating.

Long-term PPI use should be monitored by a healthcare provider.
preventive strategies: Avoid trigger foods and overeating.Maintain a healthy weight. Eat smaller, more frequent meals. Avoid lying down immediately after eating.
